arts.ttl: Man Utd fans hail Hannibal Mejbri after taunting Leeds fans with gesture
arts.sum: Hannibal Mejbri certainly enjoyed his day out in Leeds during Burnley's 1-0 win after getting one over on supporters who had mocked him in 2020 during a Man United FA Youth Cup game

arts.ttl: Surgery concern for Leeds United man as details of specific injury setback emerge
arts.sum: Leeds United may be without Max Wöber for the upcoming home game against Burnley, as he looks to recover from a meniscus issue. Leeds haven’t had to contend with many injury issues of late, which is one less headache for Daniel Farke to contend with after his star players were sold during July and August.

arts.ttl: Key Leeds player open to new contract but will push to leave in January if no agreement found
arts.sum: Junior Firpo is destined to leave Leeds United in January if he cannot agree a new contract with the club, according to reports. Firpo is entering his fourth season at Elland Road after joining from Barcelona in 2021, making 90 appearances across all competitions during that time. The former Spain youth international — who now […] The post Key Leeds player open to new contract but will push to leave in January if no agreement found appeared first on CaughtOffside.

arts.ttl: Patrick Bamford's omission from Leeds United squad explained as Will Ferrell watches Burnley loss
arts.sum: "If I am honest, after this difficult international break and just one training session together and with so many players travelling, I didn’t expect we would be that dominant in how we played. "We dominated each and every statistic and where we have to be self-critical is that in the decisive moments of the game, we were not effective.

arts.ttl: Daniel Farke press conference LIVE as Leeds United boss reacts to tight Burnley loss
arts.sum: The second half saw no further goals. Follow everything the manager has to say about Saturday afternoon's match below as we bring you most of the questions and answers in full from the debrief.

arts.ttl: Angus Kinnear makes bold Red Bull, Leeds United statement with “top-ten” prediction
arts.sum: Leeds United CEO Angus Kinnear is adamant that financial investment from Red Bull will not lead to any radical club changes that have taken place in the Energy Drink giants’ other club projects. “I think to give the fans some kind of reassurance in the direction of travel, I think over the last couple of weeks, you’ll have seen that Red Bull have announced more traditional sponsorship deals.

arts.ttl: Scott Parker reacts to controversial Leeds United vs Burnley flashpoint
arts.sum: Burnley head coach Scott Parker has claimed referee James Bell got the big decision right in their win at Leeds United. By joining the Leeds United community on WhatsApp, you'll see the biggest and best stories as soon as they happen.

arts.ttl: Leeds United again fall foul of Daniel Farke shortcoming in 1-0 Burnley defeat
arts.sum: As Leeds took control of possession, with the Clarets sitting deep and soaking up pressure to hit Leeds on the break, little came in the way of chances with the game going on, outside of a Willy Gnonto opening that was hit straight at Trafford. Instead, Leeds looked less potent and progressive with each change that was confirmed – more and more lifeless in possession despite the fresh legs, while Burnley got mileage out of those who came on, be that winning fouls or other dirty work to see out the win.

arts.ttl: Scott Parker pinpoints key ingredient that earned Burnley 'massive' win against Leeds United
arts.sum: Scott Parker felt Burnley’s grit, determination and never-say-die mentality was the key to their “massive” win against Leeds United.

arts.ttl: Burnley player ratings vs Leeds United as one man catches the eye with 8/10 performance - gallery
arts.sum: Burnley produced a resilient rearguard display to claim a big three points against promotion rivals Leeds United.
